name: Special Edition
description: A famous writer approaches your printing house with an offer to produce a special, limited edition of one of their previously published works, or a brand new edition of a previously unpublished story. This event can occur multiple times at the GMâ€™s discretion, but never more than twice a game year.

criticalSuccess.msg: The special edition proves to be a rousing success! <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="resource-dice" data-mode="gain" data-turn="next" data-multiple="false" data-value="2">Gain 2 Resource Dice Next Turn</button> and <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="luxuries" data-mode="gain" data-turn="next" data-multiple="false" data-value="1d4">Gain 1d4 Luxuries Next Turn</button>

success.msg: The special edition is popular but takes a while to sell out. <button type="button" class="km-gain-lose" data-type="resource-dice" data-mode="gain" data-turn="next" data-multiple="false" data-value="1">Gain 1 Resource Dice Next Turn</button>

failure.msg: The special edition fails to connect with any readers and provides no significant benefit to your nation as a result.

criticalFailure.msg: The special edition is controversial in some way and incites anger in a key portion of your population. Increase a Ruin of your choice by 1
